item.title: Exploring GraphQL With .NET Core
item.description: Understanding GraphQL GraphQL, developed by Facebook, is a query language for APIs that provides a more efficient, flexible, and powerful alternative to traditional REST APIs. Released in 2015, GraphQL allows clients to request exactly the data they need, addressing common issues associated with REST, such as over-fetching and under-fetching of data. Why GraphQL? The primary goal of GraphQL is to optimize data retrieval. Traditional REST APIs often force clients to accept fixed responses, leading to over-fetching (receiving more data than necessary) or under-fetching (not receiving enough data, necessitating multiple requests).
